definitions.text: a payment or series of payments made by the lessee to an owner for use of some property, facility, equipment, or service
an opening made forcibly as by pulling apart
examples: there was a rip in his pants
she had snags in her stockings

definitions.text: the return derived from cultivated land in excess of that derived from the poorest land cultivated under similar conditions
the act of rending or ripping or splitting something
examples: he gave the envelope a vigorous rip
We rented our apartment to friends while we were abroad

definitions.text: grant use or occupation of under a term of contract
examples: I am leasing my country estate to some foreigners

definitions.text: engage for service under a term of contract
examples: We took an apartment on a quiet street
Shall we take a guide in Rome?

definitions.text: hold under a lease or rental agreement; of goods and services

examples: The curtain ripped from top to bottom
pull the cooked chicken into strips
